hierarchyTerminal

public static boolean hierarchyTerminal(Class<?> type,
                                        List<String> packagePrefixes)

Determines if the given type terminates an endpoint lookup along an inheritance hierarchy.

This evaluation is performed using a basic conditional check which will return true if the given type is in the specified packages list. If a package list is not provided, the hierarchy is deemed to have terminated if the given type is ina a package whose name starts with "android.", "java.", "javax." or "junit.".

Will be rendered obsolete if a future enhancement allows isolation of packages to scan for endpoint injection.

Parameters:
type - the Class of the type to be checked for hierarchy termination

packagePrefixes - the packages prefixes to restrict the inheritance hierarchy to; else null or empty to specify the restriction packages as "android.", "java.", "javax." or "junit."

Returns:
true if this type represents a termination in the hierarchy

Since:
1.2.4
